text:
e="preserve">In statistics, an estimator is a rule for calculating an estimate of a given amount based on observed data: thus the rule (the estimator), the amount that is being measured (the estimand) and its result (the estimate) are different.
An estimator of a parameter formula_1 is often written as formula_1. If the expected value of the estimator is equal to the parameter, then the estimator is called unbiased. Otherwise, it is called biased.
